message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.GT 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper focuses on IoT sensors and their wireless communication for data sensing and transmission, which falls under the scope of networking and internet architecture. 
2. cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) - The paper discusses data security and privacy issues in existing IoT platforms and proposes the use of permissionless blockchains for distributed ledger services, which falls under the scope of cryptography and security. 
3. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper proposes a purely decentralized platform for data storage and trading using blockchain technology, which falls under the scope of distributed computing. 
4. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) - The paper formulates a noncooperative game model to analyze the competitive situation among the sensors, which falls under the scope of data structures and algorithms. 
5. cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory) - The paper uses game theory to analyze the competitive situation among the sensors and provides insights into the equilibrium strategies in the game, which falls under the scope of computer science and game theory.
